answers.answer: I'm really sorry that you are not feeling well.I have never heard of anyone talking about hypoglycemia with MS, nor have I read about it, but I really am not sure. I am undx, but have people ask me all the time if I am hypoglycemic because if I don't eat I turn into a freak! I am not overweight, nor do I have diabetes. When they were trying to figure out why I was tingling they tested my blood sugar and it was fine even though I had not eaten yet that day. My vit D was low though. Have you had your vit D checked??? It can cause some crazy things.What else happened to you other than the tingling and twitching in your mouth when they told you you had a seizure???Feel better,Heather

question: So, this morning I felt really bad.  I wasn't sure if I was going to have another seizure--fortunately I am on Keppra for this, so that gave me a little relief.  I did not have anything to eat to start the day.  Just 2 cups of coffee.  Is hypoglycemia a big problem for those with MS?  I ate a little and started to feel a bit better.  It is not usual for me to start the day with coffee and wait a couple of hours for food.
title: not feling well
